slides.title: Constitution Basics
slides.content:
**Adopted:** 26 Jan 1950 (Republic Day)
**Preamble:** Socialist, Secular, Democratic, Republic
**Parts:** 25 | **Articles:** 448+ | **Schedules:** 12
**Father:** Dr. B.R. Ambedkar

slides.title: Fundamental Rights
slides.content:
**6 Rights (Articles 14-35):**
1. Equality (14-18)
2. Freedom (19-22)
3. Against Exploitation (23-24)
4. Religion (25-28)
5. Culture & Education (29-30)
6. Constitutional Remedies (32)

slides.title: Government Structure
slides.content:
**President:** Head of State, 5 years
**PM:** Head of Government
**Parliament:** Lok Sabha (543) + Rajya Sabha (245)
**Judiciary:** Supreme Court (apex), High Courts, District Courts
**States:** Governor (appointed), CM (elected)

question.questionText: On which date was the Indian Constitution adopted?
question.explanation: The Indian Constitution came into effect on 26 January 1950, which is celebrated as Republic Day.
